pullRequest.body:
- Define the `WithAbs` type synonym equipping a ring with a valuation
- Refactor `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion` to `Valuation.Completion`, making use of the `Valued` instance on `WithVal`
- Fix errors generated by the above changes in mathlib

---

- [x] depends on: #22139

Following a [comment and TODO on YaÃ«lâ€™s recent PR](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21301#discussion_r1956184620), I decided to resurrect and push a local branch of mine from last year where I played around with a `WithVal` type synonym and refactor of `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion` in analogy to `WithAbs` and `InfinitePlace.Completion`. I never pushed it because I was concerned that it would have a big impact on downstream work, but following the above comment I think itâ€™s worth having a discussion about this refactor in this PR. As expected, the refactor generated a number of errors across some files, which Iâ€™ve fixed, but I know there is a lot of work happening in this area outside of mathlib, so Iâ€™ve requested reviews from people that I know are currently using `adicCompletion`. Keen to hear everyoneâ€™s thoughts and concerns about this.

My two cents is that this would make it a lot easier to work with `adicCompletion` long term, but itâ€™s not clear to me how disruptive this would be to others' work and whether itâ€™s worth it.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

`+ instance [Field R] : Field (WithVal v) := â€¹Field Râ€º`

`+ instance {S : Type*} [SMul S R] : SMul S (WithVal v)`

`- adicCompletion_completeSpace`

`- valuedAdicCompletion`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Don't forget to remove `awaiting-author` if you think you've addressed all the changes!

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22139~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thanks, LGTM!
Amazing! Looks like a great improvement.
Thanks, LGTM!
This change looks like it makes up most of the diff. Personally, I am not convinced it is useful. Could you either drop it or move it to a separate PR?

We could drop it, but then `WithVal` cannot infer `K` from `v.valuation`, so we would need to write `WithVal (v.valuation : Valuation K â„¤â‚˜â‚€))` or `WithVal (v.valuation (K := K))` everywhere. Maybe the latter is preferable to the explicit arg? I don't have strong opinions here, but `WithVal (v.valuation : Valuation K  â„¤â‚˜â‚€))` is a bit long to keep writing
I'm not particularly for or against. I just think it should be discussed separately, ie in another PR
OK makes sense! Have reverted that change

I have been planning to give a proper review to this PR, but overall I believe it is really good. On the other hand, I dissent from @YaelDillies 's point: not having to write `K` is a very good reason for it, and I thing this change highly appropriate for this PR. It makes up for most of the diff, but in a very "trivial manner", so I would suggest re-reverting .

> not having to write `K` is a very good reason for it

Then it can be a preliminary PR
This is a very good idea! @smmercuri Do not hesitate to ping me if you open the new PR.
Preliminary PR here! #22139

```suggestion
    Valued.v (r : v.adicCompletion K) = v.valuation K r := by
```

```suggestion
    (v.valuationOfNeZeroToFun x : â„¤â‚˜â‚€) = v.valuation K x := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [show v.valuation K x = _ * _ by rfl]
```

```suggestion
    (Polynomial.idealX K).valuation _ P = (PowerSeries.idealX K).valuation Kâ¸¨Xâ¸© P := by
```

```suggestion
theorem embedding_apply (x : K) : embedding v x = â†‘x := rfl
```

```suggestion
    toNNReal (norm_ne_zero v) ((WithVal.instValued (v.valuation K)).v x) =
```
I guess you'll remove those comments before merging?

I wasn't sure what the best practice is here. I thought it might be useful to leave them as comments in case there's any future confusing about missing named instances, but I don't really mind and can delete them if you think that's best.
I think deleting is best here
Now removed
Yuck. What happened here?

Yeah... this one gave me a headache. I think a diamond is happening so this was a plaster to make it behave as it did before. To be honest, I'm not sure this instance is required as deleting it gave no errors. @faenuccio do you know whether this instance is needed?
I do not think is needed any more, so you can safely delete it.

```suggestion
# Ring topologised by a valuation
```

```suggestion
/-- Type synonym for a ring equipped with the topology coming from a valuation. -/
```
@smmercuri, please change this in the file header too.
I don't think the codomain can be an outParam since one might have several different G0s for the same R. outParam only works when R completely determines G0.
Oh yes, thanks! removed

In this prelimiary doc I would suggest that you explain a bit more in detail how to use the type `WithVal`: for instance, you say that `WithVal v` is a type synonim for `R` without saying what the relation between `v` and `R` is. You might also add a word about why it is useful.
Sounds good, added some more info
Is this needed?
No, I think I just copied it over from `WithAbs`. I've removed it and `Nontrivial` which was also not needed
This also can be inferred automatically, now.
pehaps a @simp?
I have made `embedding_apply` simp instead as that would be more useful I think
Actually, this caused some downstream errors in another file, so reverting this for now

pullRequest.title: feat: `WithVal` type synonym and refactor of `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion`
